benchmark_details.name: BALROG: Benchmarking Agentic LLM and VLM Reasoning On Games
benchmark_details.overview: BALROG is a novel benchmark designed to assess the agentic capabilities of LLMs and VLMs through a diverse set of challenging games, incorporating various existing reinforcement learning environments.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To assess the agentic capabilities of long-context LLMs and VLMs across a diverse set of complex, long-horizon tasks in gaming environments.

data.source: A suite of six reinforcement learning environments including BabyAI, Crafter, TextWorld, Baba Is AI, MiniHack, and NetHack.

methodology.calculation: Scores are calculated based on task completion and fine-grained metrics for model evaluation in RL environments.
methodology.interpretation: Higher scores indicate better agent performance, with progress calculated against the game's difficulty levels.
methodology.validation: Performance is validated using statistical significance with multiple evaluation seeds.
